instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-B liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi,
I have a liquid damaged board 820-2936-B.
After ultrasonic cleaning it looks good and board turns on with or without battery.
It stays on for about 30 sec to 45 seconds. Sometimes it stays on long enough to have the OS up. (It has a SSD drive)
But it suddenly turns off by itself and don't turn back on unless I disconnect the battery.
When the board is on fan spins at it's maximum speed!
Any suggestion? What should I check and measure?
Thanks,

threads.title: 820-2936-B liquid damage
threads.message: Crap under the SMC is a good start. But as you removed all corrosion you also removed all evidence.

threads.title: 820-2936-B liquid damage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 30432"]Crap under the SMC is a good start. But as you removed all corrosion you also removed all evidence.[/QUOTE]

Do you mean I should replace the SMC?

threads.title: 820-2936-B liquid damage
threads.message: Reflow with some flux would be the first thing to try. But it all depends on where the corrosion was.
